program_title: Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grants
program_description: This program helps small, financially-distressed rural communities pay for predevelopment feasibility studies, design, and technical assistance for proposed water and waste disposal projects.
eligible_area_criteria_1: Must be rural, considered financially distressed
eligible_area_criteria_2: Located in cities, towns, or unincorporated areas with populations of 2,500 or fewer, according to the most recent U.S. Census data
eligible_area_criteria_3: Median household incomes either below the poverty line - or less than 80 percent of the statewide, nonmetropolitan median household income - using 2006 - 2010 American Community Survey data
eligible_area_criteria_4: Builds or relocates public or private buildings, roads, bridges, fences, or utilities, or makes other improvements necessary for the successful operation or protection of facilities
how_funds_can_be_used_1: Feasibility studies to support applications for funding water or waste disposal projects
how_funds_can_be_used_3: Technical assistance to develop applications for financial assistance
additional_requirements_description: Predevelopment planning costs must be related to a proposed project that builds, enlarges, extends, or improves rural water, wastewater, solid waste, or storm water disposal facilities
how_to_get_started_applications_accepted: Year-round through your local USDA Rural Development office
governing_program_cfr_title_part: Code of Federal Regulations, Title 7, Part 1774
governing_program_act_section: Section 306 of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act
note_consult_official_instructions: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
